website_summaries.verdict: Great construction for a much cheaper price than others with similar capacity and design.
pros: A nice bag for a great price
Features rainproof materials and durable zipper closures
Adjustable straps with standard buckles attach to any roof rack
cons: Better for shorter trips, as it can start to get tiny rips after longer highway drives
"Rainproof" does not mean waterproof, so stronger storms might cause the bag to leak

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs!
customer_reviews.text: We just finished an 11 hour drive to Florida and an 11 hour drive back home. This thing is amazing. It holds so much!!! I had a stroller in it, two skim boards, 2 boogie boards. A huge totes tub full of various items for the beach. A beach chair. Several pieces of luggage, a queen air mattress and much more! We also went through several rainy spots and the items inside stayed dry. This was east to put on the roof of our van and easy to strap down with the provided straps. I can't say enough good things about this carrier! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C.

customer_reviews.title: Figure out tie down system before hand
customer_reviews.text: This product is fine. We did not use it in the rain so I don't know how waterproof it is, but looking at the fabric, I think it would be fine. My brain could not follow the way to tie it down. The straps are not attached. The fact that it was 30 degrees out and windy didn't help. Plan ahead and figure it out before you need it. Once on, tie the remaining strap ends together so they don't flap in the wind while driving. It's noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saving Grace
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is my saving grace! Moved from SC to AR and wow did she hold up. We put her on our Malibu with a car mat, it held a ton of stuff. It saved us from having to rent a truck which gets pricey when moving state to state, great price for a great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: It is a good size bag, but was difficult to keep down when driving 70+mph
customer_reviews.text: I was driving from Miami to Atlanta with this. The front keep getting lifted by the wind no matter how hard I try to strap it down and to put heavier items in the front. It keeps getting lifted and it was a constant thumping on the roof the whole trip. Every 2 hours I had to strap it down more since I was afraid it was going to fly off. The straps gets loosen about every 2 hours, and I get paranoid. It is a good size top carrier, but Maybe I will look for something better next time. It was a one time use for me.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Vo

customer_reviews.title: built tuff and dust proof.
customer_reviews.text: 5 star plus ! Used this on the roof of my utv to make a 450 mile trip thru the desert and mountains. it made it thru trees dust and rain ! the straps are kinda goofy but they get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Roof Carrier
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Worked well on my 2006 Subaru Outback. It is a bit larger than the space in my roof rack, but because it is flexible, I was able to make it work safely and well. Position it behind the front cross bar and let it go over the rear cross bar, but keep it within the side rails and you will be fine. Straps fasten it down tightly so there is no movement in wind or during turns.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Oskamp

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Will use again!
customer_reviews.text: What a great value for the money. Then we needed something to carry some extra toys and baggage with us and didn't want to spend a lot of money. Attached it to the top of her Toyota Highlander and it did fantastically through a storm and nothing got wet inside. Easy to install easy to take apart fold up and wrap up the chords. Great by oh, really happy we got it. Zippers did great! Really fits a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Raiser

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money - wind ripped holes
customer_reviews.text: It did keep our items dry when we went through rain in the early parts of our trip. However, we had it strapped down with the straps it comes with as well as our own ratchet straps and tight so no extra material flapping or anything, and yet the wind ripped two tennis ball size holes in it. We got one use out of it. I purchased a different brand one a couple years ago and it worked wonders but left it with my parents in another state for them to use so had to buy a new one. I don't recommend this one. Waste of money as we can't use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra S.

customer_reviews.title: Overlanding approved!
customer_reviews.text: Five stars because it lasted, and is still in good shape after Overlanding the 161 mile long RimRocker trail from Montrose Co. to Moab Ut. and back. Went through dusty, rainy, 110 degree heat to 40 degree nights. Plenty of space for gear. No straps broke during 4 wheeling or highway. Kept my stuff dry. In my opinion it is for best use with roof rack.
customer_reviews.author: 4rnr

customer_reviews.title: Decent and affordable
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag for a camping trip, knowing that it might be only good for the one trip. It's lasted us two years of trips now. It's a bit fiddly to set up but it stores a lot of stuff. This is a good option if you need just a bit more space in your car, but a trailer of some kind is off the table. It did rain quite a bit during our last drive but everything inside the bag is dry.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn S.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Comparing to a $500 rooftop box, this bag does the same job while taking less space when not used, and it is way cheaper. I was also surprised how durable and weather-proof it is. We made a wrong call and entered a parking structure with limited clearance. The bag got scraped on a lot of times (since I was too lazy to take stuff out of it) and still good. It finally got a small tear but it was small enough that it kept our gears dry in a pouring rain. Definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Great extra storage - wind noise through the straps
customer_reviews.text: Lots of extra room for stuff, but be aware if you strap it down across the roof (left to right) the wind noise above 30 MPH will get your attention! As my vehicle does have a roof rack, I took the cross-wise straps and just doubled up the front to back ones which eliminated the noise. Did not notice an appreciable decrease in gas mileage. Only encountered light rain, but everything inside was completely dry.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for something like this, you want quality; however, most of us don't want to pay an arm and a leg for it either. I moved cross county and was amazed at how much I was able to fit in this on top of my Pontiac Vibe. As others has suggested purchase additional stretchy clamps (lots of them). Even when it rained there were no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Maxine Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Great bag even better price
customer_reviews.text: Great roof bag, especially for the money. My only negative comment would be that I wish 3 sides unzipped, rather that just two. It made loading items a little hard. Other than that, it is made of good material. Zippers worked good. And I got caught in a heavy rain storm, for about an hour, and everything inside stayed dry.
customer_reviews.author: Tara B

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Worked out great! The straps are a little cheap, just make sure to knot them at the end.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This bag was not ableto make it half way, of it's first trip, before ripping. We were not driving in bad weather conditions, and we did not over pack the bag. We had 2 medium sized suitcases in the bag. We took one of the tiedown straps provided and wrapped around the bag, to help tie down the extra bag material. The bag started to ripp in the first 300 miles. Before we could return homethe ripp enlarged drastically. We would have been ok, except we had to drive the lat 200 miles in the rain. All suitcases were soaked when we got home.
customer_reviews.author: red

customer_reviews.title: Worked absolutely Perfectly Fine! Saw the complaints about cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: Worked absolutely Perfectly Fine! Saw the complaints about cheap quality, tears, rips after one use. I experienced none. Took on top of mini van with ratchet strapped down over 1,700 mile vacation trip. Pulled down / put up twice everyday for 8 days. Never one problem or concern. I did use prejudice caution to not damage / break zipper / or rip it; and thus it worked flawlessly. I can see if you mistreat or abuse it; it will fail.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Brittle and weak. Won’t last with any amount of highway use.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Drove from Illinois to South Dakota with this and the wind alone tore it apart leaving cracks and holes all over. Noticed a few tears just after just several hours of driving. Right outside Sioux Falls some rain moved in soaking the luggage inside. Everything was assembled correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Chase T. Douthit

customer_reviews.title: Fits a lot and durable, but hard to mount ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits a lot and durable, but hard to mount and shapes to whatever is inside so lots of drag unless you pack it just right to fill all corners symmetrically.
customer_reviews.author: cathy smith

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: Game changer! Holds so much stuff! Very durable, no complaints. We are a family of 5. We have a third row GMC Acadia. We have one year old twins. We took our nanny with us on vaca. In this carrier we had 2 highchairs, side by side stroller, beach necessities, blankets, towels, toys, and a few other last minute items and we had no issues cruising through the mountains at 70mph.
customer_reviews.author: tnsmith08

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! I drove all the way from NC to TX and this thing held a bunch of stuff and stayed put. I was a little worried about it flapping around and road noise but it was really quiet! We drove through two storms and all my stuff came out dry as a bone. For reference I drove a Hyundai Tucson.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well but isn't waterproof..
customer_reviews.text: It did the job however we drove through a small patch of pretty heavy rain and some of our stuff was a little damp. It wasn't enough to keep us from using it though. I would recommend not putting anything valuable in it!
customer_reviews.author: jshell

customer_reviews.title: This unit is awesome..
customer_reviews.text: This unit is awesome...I ordered it 2 days before leaving on a ski vacation. We packed all of our ski clothes, 2 huge Baseball style totes, ski boots, and 2 suitcases... It all fit well. and the straps were simple to install, and provided a secure tote on the roof On the way home we encountered every weather possible from blizzard, to freezing rain, torrential down pours, and gusty winds. When we finally made it home after 9-1/2 hrs of mother nature's onslaught, all of our things were secure and DRY!!. This is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Pauly

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for my daughter to transport her things to ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for my daughter to transport her things to college on top of her Audi A6. Rode well on top of her car and it took the rainstorm and bugs well on its maiden voyage to Idaho.
customer_reviews.author: kkwalker

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Clips on Straps Broke
customer_reviews.text: I used the carrier for the first time for a 90 mile trip. The carrier protected the contents during rain on the way there. The problem occurred when strapping it to return home. Two of the plastic clips on the straps broke when fastening the carrier to the roof of the vehicle. I tied them and returned home. I wrote to Horizon Global / Reese and received an auto response. No one has contacted me in over 6 days. The 1 star rating is for the clips breaking in first trip and no customer service response. I’ll be buying new straps with metal clips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed, water resistant
customer_reviews.text: I've used it a few times now and it works great. Much better made than some I've had. Heavy construction but easy to load and use with or without racks. Get a car mat, it makes a difference. This one really holds a lot and seems water resistant. I drove through som e ferocious storms for 6 hours and everything remained dry.
customer_reviews.author: Cabh

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It performed as described. I used it on a 2200+ mile trip through lots of rain and no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Goss

customer_reviews.title: Great for moving
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a cross country move and it worked great!! For the price and durability of the product you really can’t best it! I unfortunately didn’t have cross bars to attach it to but I purchased a mat and was able to attach it to the handles inside my car.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Company does not respond to product defect issues
customer_reviews.text: The carrier was used once. One the the straps broke while securing the carrier to the car. We had to use duct tape to secure to the car. Looked awful, but at least we were able to get our daughters belongings to college. I have contacted the company three times (with automated response received assuring me they have received my contact). I am just looking for the replacement strap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great value and really sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value and really sturdy. The only design flaw is the plastic thing you loop the tie strap through. No matter how I wove it through it would not cinch and stay. I ended up tying a knot after it to keep it from slipping right out
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Newton

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly reliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this carrier almost two years ago and packed it full when I moved from the midwest to the PNW. I drove almost 2,000 miles during the summer, through some pretty intense thunderstorms and windstorms. The carrier stayed fully secured the entire time, and everything in the carrier remained dry despite hours in the pouring rain. I've used the carrier many times since and it's still in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Gracious

customer_reviews.title: It did the trick!
customer_reviews.text: We traveled thousands of miles over a 12 day period and had no issues. Sealed well no rain got in. Handled the heat of the sun. Never came loose. I would recommend it to anyone. One note: it works best full, I used jackets and small packages to fill the empty spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on an 1800 mile trip - easy to mount, a little awkward to load on top of a Chevy Tahoe - needed a step stool.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: We used this to protect some gear in a roof basket for a camping trip. Overall it worked well, keeping our stuff dry. It has one zipper, which wraps around 2 sides. Also comes with a storage bag, which is too small to be useable.
customer_reviews.author: Matt A

customer_reviews.title: Wish I got it sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I wish the zipper was on the passenger side but other than that... very good. All my stuff stayed dry and it packs up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value. Took on 3
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. Took on 3,000 mike round trip and held up fine. Highly recommend listening to the other reviewers who’ve said to use your own ratchet straps to tie it down. Would not have gone so well if we hadn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Annonymous

customer_reviews.title: 1800+ miles 12 hours of driving each way!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag worked great for us. We drove from VA to FLA. It poured in some locations along our ride. We only put beach stuff and things that were ok to get wet after reading some reviews.. but nothing got wet. The bag did the job. The straps were very easy to figure out and very secure with a roof rack on a minivan. We would buy again and recommend this item. Inexpensive but very good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rain proof but straps don't seem secure
customer_reviews.text: Definitely rain proof. Just had to use extra straps cuz we didn't feel confident with just those 4 little straps that don't stay together very well
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Howell

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: This went across the country twice in rain, snow, & subzero temperatures. Zippers held up & everything was clean and dry. We used better straps though just to be sure. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L.

customer_reviews.title: In a pickup bed
customer_reviews.text: I used this in the back of my truck to put luggage in during our last vacation. Worked like a champ. Kept everything perfectly dry. We went through several heavy thunderstorms and it held up 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan wilmot

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This carrier worked perfectly for our needs on a recent camping trip. It held over half of all our stuff and was easy to setup, secure and break down to store for another day. Good quality construction and straps especially for the price. Happy I have this now for future trips or just in case we need to haul something last minute.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dowdy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Good Value
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this last minute to use for a family trip. It held up to the rain and being used daily, and we had no issues with any tearing or quality. It stayed in place nicely and was easy to use. Would definitely recommend, and am glad we made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ataylorfam

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Drive from RI to TN and back with this on the roof. Loaded it with 2 carry on suit cases, a large duffel bag, full size comforter, three pillows and other miscellaneous things, well worth it!. We did use our own ratchet straps, the ones it comes with looked flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good for extra storage on small cars,
customer_reviews.text: Used it on my rackless Prius C on a trip from NJ to GA. Make sure to add more straps as the ones it came with were cheap plastic. (I used 3 of these  I also added a pad to help keep it from scratching and sliding. still looks good and intact.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you want to throw your money away, buy this carrier bag.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on this! This was awful. We used it once and by the time we arrived at our destination, it had holes worn through. We taped it back together to get home. When we got home, the tape was perfect, the carrier had new holes. Of course we were just past our return point with Amazon so we had to eat the cost. Buy anything else!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Kochenderfer

customer_reviews.title: It's a steal! Loved it and seriously used it.
customer_reviews.text: We drove from San Diego to seattle and back , camping. Unloaded and loaded like 12 times and it was fast and easy! Zero wear on the bag. What a steal this product is!
customer_reviews.author: Nikalaily

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a three week road trip. Strapped and I strapped daily. Fit everything for a family of four. One of the clips broke about a week into the trip. But was able to tie it off. Wasn't fun to take off everyday, but wasn't difficult. Overall a good product with an excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: Antionatte

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well. Even driving in heavy rain, ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well. Even driving in heavy rain, it kept all luggage dry. The only draw back was that it was easier to load off vehicle and then put it on the vehicle, which did make for a heavy lift. At every stop we did tighten down the straps, but very little.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very roomy!!
customer_reviews.text: Very roomy. Fit all our luggage for 4 people and two beach chairs, beach towels and blanket, 2 pillows and we had lots of room for more!!!!! Worked fine with only side rails. We went from Pa to VA. Little rain no leaks. Great 👍🏻 item!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Worked well with rubber base mat for my long trip
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Rabadan

customer_reviews.title: Frayed on first use
customer_reviews.text: I would give 0 stars if that were possible. The item frayed on its first use and of course it rained and got the items inside soaked. You'd think it would be made of stronger material able to withstand interstate speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for what it is
customer_reviews.text: It worked about as well as we expected it to. It protected our bags from the average rain but we did run into some REALLY heavy rain at one point where the bag took in some water and pooled at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is great to be able to put things on the roof rack and not have to deal with the hard case. I haven't seen any water issues and we had quite a bit of rain coming, going and while loading up.
customer_reviews.author: Beequa

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for our 10 hour drive. It did not rain so I am not sure how it would hold up with the weather.
customer_reviews.author: Ahugh

customer_reviews.title: Bag
customer_reviews.text: If it lasts as long as my first one I'll be extremely happy. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Booyah!

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: it is so much bigger than i truly expected. drove from Iowa to Florida, and back again, in winter. it held wonderfully... what more can i say?
customer_reviews.author: Kat D.

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for our vacation. The straps were secure even riding at high speeds on the highway. It held more than I had anticipated from the images. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kim A

customer_reviews.title: installed with zipper facing front of vehicle as instructions stated ...
customer_reviews.text: installed with zipper facing front of vehicle as instructions stated and it leaked. installed the other way on the way home and it was fine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought as gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought as gift and product held up really well on interstate travel.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Traveled 150 miles, about half of it in a severe rain storm, with no issues. Have a small hole in the fabric, most likely from me dragging it.
customer_reviews.author: conect11@aol.com

customer_reviews.title: Great value and works well!
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect solution for a family of 6 traveling 17 hours in the car for a week long vacation. Straps were easy to use and did not loosen much at all while on the road (always check when you stop though). Drove a total of 34 hours in lots of rain and no problems. Only complaint- I wish the zipper went 3/4 of the way around instead of 2/4. But very minor complaint.
customer_reviews.author: AMuehlenweg

customer_reviews.title: Great for my cross country move!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to store my space bagged clothing for my cross country move. It did not move on top of my car and was durable the whole way. I highly recommend this product. The price is a steal for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: lisaMike

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price, however did tear slightly in my cross country journey.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for our trip from St. Louis to ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for our trip from St. Louis to Phoenix. It did have tears in it by the time we got there so can’t use again but held a ton of stuff so I’m not complaining :)
customer_reviews.author: stacybeauty

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT waterproof. Our stuff was soaking wet after we hit a rain shower.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... these on a last minute thing and they were great!!
customer_reviews.text: I had to order these on a last minute thing and they were great!!!!! We went camping and it rained....and nothing got wet!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: LIES
customer_reviews.text: Does not keep any water out!!! We had to throw out some of our belongings and the bag because so much water got in and made things moldy!!!! SO DISAPPOINTED.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Started ripping withing the first hour of driving
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to take on a road trip around 900 miles each way. By the time I got to the destination the bag had so many rips in it that I had to buy Duct tape to repair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did it's job
customer_reviews.text: I fit more into it than I thought I would. I could not use the included straps for the sides, so I used my own. Every vehicle is different.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan James

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I used this stuffed as full as possible, on top of a kia Spectra with no rails. I used actual ratchet straps and had a kids mattress and giant racetrack tower toy strapped on top of the carrying case. We went all the way from Central Florida to Southwest Missouri and everything was dry and right where I put it when we got to Missouri. Would def use again.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Light & flexible
customer_reviews.text: This came in handy for our family vacation with three little ones. It helped store all the little extras we had to take that wouldn’t fit in the trunk. It’s very durable and easy to store
customer_reviews.author: Lana Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hold allot took it for a weekend camping trip wish I bought it sooner
customer_reviews.author: jamie harris

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I drove from the east coast to the west coast in the rain and it held up. Nothing got wet or ruined
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Nicole Odom

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Drove from Michigan to Seattle, ripped wide open on day two. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Optimific

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used it from Michigan to Florida and back. It rained most of the way. No rips or leaks.
customer_reviews.author: todd r.

customer_reviews.title: Started to disintegrate on second day I used.
customer_reviews.text: I only used this carrier twice for a total drive time of 11 hours. I noticed after the second trip how the material broke down. I did not overfill with luggage.
customer_reviews.author: scott sinkula

customer_reviews.title: BEST THING EVER
customer_reviews.text: BEST THING EVER! I'm a single mom with 2 kids, a dog and a Rav4. By the time we pack all the food and pots and pans and things to go camping, the way back is full. Used this and packed all our clothes, towels, blankets, etc - pretty much anything other than food. It has TONS of space and is super easy to tie down. Best carrier ever. Everyone else had their minivans stuffed and we were set in the Rav4 with this on top. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Pammers

customer_reviews.title: Great, cheap car top carrier
customer_reviews.text: Excellent car top carrier. We had no problems with and it held up great.We were amazed how much it held too. I couldn't beat the great low price either.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a easy trip to California from Arizona didn’t last the trip out. It started to rip. I tried to get ahold of the company but have not been contacted. I wouldn’t use them again unless the find away to make this product better
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: First time using a carrier that wasn't hard shell. Worked very well on four hour trip. Stayed secure and was easy to mount on top of car. I definitely would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jan A Neuman

customer_reviews.title: I recommend bagging things before you pack it up
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for my purpose however it rained a little on the trip and there was wetness inside. I recommend bagging things before you pack it up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not good quality!
customer_reviews.text: bag ripped on 1st use, not pleased with it at all
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Alexander

customer_reviews.title: High quality for price
customer_reviews.text: Used it crossing the U.S. in a pickup bed. Rained many times and no dampness inside. Placed suitcases and small bags in and out of it numerous times without any difficulty except 1st time...... learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: greg edelen

customer_reviews.title: Maybe better for shorter trips
customer_reviews.text: It did not hold up well on a from California to Fort hood Texas, Started to rip. I did not use it on the way back because I was concerned with further damage. Maybe better for shorter trips.
customer_reviews.author: iliana mendoza

customer_reviews.title: very durable and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: made a 5000 mile road trip and this never let us down. Very durable and waterproof
customer_reviews.author: Robert Penrod

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. Was a little worried about the strap system ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Was a little worried about the strap system but they did fine. It rained the whole way down to the beach and everything stayed dry. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Denise L Peerey

customer_reviews.title: Very good product.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my BMW X5. Very good quality. No issues with our travels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MADE IT THERE AND SHE WAS VERY SATISFIED..
customer_reviews.text: GAVE IT TO A FRIEND MOVING TO COLORADO.....MADE IT THERE AND SHE WAS VERY SATISFIED....
customer_reviews.author: L. Gabor

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: Vague directions . we ended upputting it on upside down. We went thru rain n snow.. Stayed dry.
customer_reviews.author: Mayhmmaydn

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great value
customer_reviews.text: Great product, held a week on our car roof, drove 1000 miles trogh storm and heavy rain.product stayed intact, content stayed dry, no leaks. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Dd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Keeps things contained but the stretch out hole is frustrating
customer_reviews.author: Hans Linnemann

customer_reviews.title: I'm giving this item two stars for one reason: ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this item two stars for one reason: The zipper only opens on two sides so you have to hold it open with one hand and stuff your cargo into the far corner of the carrier hoping that it doesn't slide while you're pushing across the vehicle roof. Also make sure that you pack the stuff you don't need first or you'll have to unload the whole thing to get to what you need. If it had a zipper on the third side you could just flop the lid over and get to whatever you need. So it's hard to pack. Aside from that, the carrier seems to do well at protecting the gear.
customer_reviews.author: Jscrimy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic durable product!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! I drove from houston to tampa thru all kinds of rain! Not one bit of water inside!
customer_reviews.author: AWilloughby

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Be sure to order mat to protect paint.
customer_reviews.text: As described. Be sure to order a mat for under it to protect surface.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a champ from Dallas to Colorado and back through a rain storm and back. And it seems to be ready for the next trip.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: I like it. Only thing is loading it is an ...
customer_reviews.text: It is what I expected. I like it. Only thing is loading it is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Pat G

customer_reviews.title: It works great just be careful tightening it down
customer_reviews.text: It works great just be careful tightening it down. One of the plastic pieces broke on one of my straps so I had to use a ratchet strap to tie it down. Would have given it 5 stars otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: chuck emerson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is excellent and provided for us the extra space we needed for a recent vacation. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Large and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than expected. Works well but it’s very big. Seems to be made of good quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Bossard

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Bag tore just from one road trip. Flaps around in the wind and is LOUD. Not waterproof in the least.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Edelstein

product_meta.title: Reese Explore 1041100 Rainproof Car Top Carrier (15 Cubic Feet)
product_meta.description: The high-capacity REESE Explore Car Top Carrier frees up space in your vehicle with 15 cubic feet of rooftop storage and is ideal for packing luggage, gear and equipment. Made from a premium-quality, rainproof material with sonically welded seams, it keeps cargo dry, clean, and protected. This durable bag fits on most roof racks, rasied side rails or crossbars on a variety of cars, trucks, SUVs, vans and other large vehicles and easily attaches using the adjustable securing straps. Whenever you’re ready for an adventure, this smart storage solution is perfect for camping, road trips, outdoor activities and other excursions. In between uses, the soft, collapsible carrier can be folded and packed away using the included storage bag for convenient storage and protection.
feature_bullets: 15 CU. FT. CAPACITY: Free up space in your vehicle by packing luggage, gear and equipment in this high-capacity rooftop cargo bag.
RAINPROOF MATERIAL: Made from a premium-quality, rainproof material with sonically welded seams, this bag keeps cargo dry, clean, and protected.
UNIVERSAL FIT: Easily fits on most roof racks, raised side rails or crossbars on a variety of cars, trucks, SUVs, vans and other large vehicles with securing straps.
COLLAPSIBLE DESIGN: Soft-sided storage bag folds for easy, convenient storage when not in use and is less expensive than hard shell roof box carriers.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars234 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
